5. Provision of such rights to the English language Services are
made on the basis that the N.A.E.B. and the United States Information
Agency have the right of approval of pamphlet material, as to
content, format and price. The price of the listener pamphlet needs
to be printed on the cover of each pamphlet in the pertinent local
currency.
6. In order that pamphlet materials can be available for listener
use, the English language services agrees the terms of this
contract to feegin production of the pamphlet at the time recording
of the scripts begins.
7. Throughout the project, the English Language Services will
work closely with the N.A.E.B. and with representatives of the
United States Information Agency. It is mutually agreed that regualr
and frequent consultation will be important in insuring that project
materials be developed in such a way as to be acceptable to the
N.A.E.B. and to the U.S.I.A.
8. The English language Services will complete the development of
the required prospectus and the 65 15-minute radio scripts within a
period of six months following the effective beginning date of this
contract. Although approval of the United States Information Agency
is required before the scripts and prospectus will be accepted, the
English language Services does not agree to provide more than two
revisions of any materials deemed unsatisfactory.
